instructions:
For this test, enter the correct response for each question in the appropriate field. Use the mouse and click to move to the next and previous fields. Use the scroll bar to scroll the form up and down if necessary.

When you are done, select Submit from the Header section. Your Test Administrator may have set a time limit for the test. If there is a time limit, you will be told how much time you have. You will also notice a countdown timer on the Header of the screen showing the time remaining.

questions.label: What was the total amount spent from the petty cash fund for the month?
How much money should be in the petty cash box at this time?

Miss Underwood decides to replenish the fund to bring it back to its original balance of $100.00.  She tells you to write the check so that she can cash it at the bank.  What should be the amount of the check?
How much money should be in the petty cash box after the fund has been replenished?
Balance in petty cash book on September 1
Actual amount in petty cash box
Cash short/over (use parentheses to indicate shortage)
Balance in petty cash book on September 1
Cash short/over (add or subtract as appropriate)
Corrected balance in petty cash book
Deduct corrected balance in petty cash book

questionData.scenario:
In this situation, you are employed by Deborah Underwood, owner of a design studio, who started a petty cash fund on July 1 by cashing a check for $100. You are responsible for the fund and are to fill out a petty cash voucher for each payment made. Fill in all the information on the voucher except the signature. Approve the voucher by adding your initials as cashier.

A summary of petty cash transactions for the month is shown below the following petty cash voucher form. Prepare the petty cash voucher for the third payment made from the petty cash fund during July.

details: July 10  Paid $21.85 to Shelly Sherman for the purchase of fabric samples.
July 11  Paid $30.40 to Joe Johnston for travel expenses.
July 18  Paid $6.50 to Ginger Gann for postage.
July 25  Paid $25 to Miller Freight Company for delivery charges.

questions.question: What was the total amount spent from the petty cash fund for the month?

Miss Underwood decides to replenish the fund to bring it back to its original balance of $100.00.  She tells you to write the check so that she can cash it at the bank.  What should be the amount of the check?
How much money should be in the petty cash box after the fund has been replenished?

part2.heading: On September 1, you compare the petty cash book balance of $29.30 with the actual currency in the petty cash box.  The box contains the following:  2-$5 bills; 7-$1 bills; 10-half dollars; 8-quarters;  34-dimes; 14-nickels; and 40 pennies.

Cash short/over (use parentheses to indicate shortage)
